body_html:
@akamaus, the CMake messages need to be improved, but in that PR C_HAS_AVX, and AVX Found only signify that the compiler supports AVX code, not the system. AVX instructions are only used at runtime if the CPU actually supports AVX instructions.

The issue was that SSE4.1 (not AVX) detection was somehow broken. Unlike with AVX, we were compiling all files with SSE4.1 instructions enabled without runtime CPU detection for SSE4.1 capability.

@akamaus, the CMake messages need to be improved, but in that PR `C_HAS_AVX`, and `AVX Found` only signify that the compiler supports AVX code, not the system. AVX instructions are only used at runtime if the CPU actually supports AVX instructions.

The issue was that SSE4.1 (not AVX) detection was somehow broken. Unlike with AVX, we were compiling all files with SSE4.1 instructions enabled without runtime CPU detection for SSE4.1 capability.
